translated: I attended on the enlightenment tree;
All day long, with a loud noise,🔽I worshipped the supreme enlightenment tree.
The deed done in the vicinity🔽led me to the deva world;

I delighted in the deva world.
Sixteen thousand devas,
satisfied, gladdened, and elated,

this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
In the twenty-ninth (of my) rebirths,
I was a king called Sudassana;
I was a conqueror of the four corners (of the island),
a lord over the Rose-Apple Island.
Then a hundred and eight musical instruments,
always surrounded me;
I experienced my own deeds,
this is the fruit of attending (on the Buddha).
Whatever womb I was conceived in,
to the gods and to men.
Even when I was in my mother’s womb,
a drum was always beaten for me.
Having served the Buddha,
having experienced the perfections,
I have attained the auspicious, peaceful, immortal,
unshakable state.
For ninety-one eons
the deed I did then
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
My defilements are destroyed,
I live without defilements.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
the Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.
The four analytical insights,
the Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.”🔽Thus the elder Ekasaṅkhyā recited these verses.
